plot.name: Colorado forest
variables.name: Biomass_ag
notes: Aboveground biomass (min. tree size not specified) for 1981, based on allometry and harvest of 17 trees 6.5-36.7 cm diameter; . prim ref: Weaver and Murphy 1990; Biotropica 22(1):69-82..
citations.author: Clark
citations.title: NPP Tropical Forest: Consistent Worldwide Site Estimates, 1967-1999, R1. Dataset.
ForC_investigator: Dr. Kristina J. Anderson-Teixeira, Smithsonian Institution, teixeirak@si.edu

plot.name: Colorado forest
variables.name: ANPP_litterfall_2
notes: 18% was "woody Material", no size given;'from 2 yr, 81-2; 20 0.25 sq.m traps/plot; sampled monthly in 82, biweekly in 81; lvs+wood+fr/flwr+"misc.". prim ref: Weaver and Murphy 1990; Biotropica 22(1):69-82..
citations.author: Clark
citations.title: NPP Tropical Forest: Consistent Worldwide Site Estimates, 1967-1999, R1. Dataset.
ForC_investigator: Dr. Kristina J. Anderson-Teixeira, Smithsonian Institution, teixeirak@si.edu

plot.name: Colorado forest
variables.name: ANPP_folivory
notes: Followed herbivory of tagged leaves over 3 mo., to 12 m ht. maximum, got 1% herbivory in 90 days, extrapolated to 4% over a year;converted to /ha with LAI values based on plumb bob data and standing leaf biomass from mass/area relation. prim ref: Weaver and Murphy 1990; Biotropica 22(1):69-82..
citations.author: Clark
citations.title: NPP Tropical Forest: Consistent Worldwide Site Estimates, 1967-1999, R1. Dataset.
ForC_investigator: Dr. Kristina J. Anderson-Teixeira, Smithsonian Institution, teixeirak@si.edu
